Courses Taught Since her appointment at Georgia Tech, Prof. Huang has regularly taught three graduate courses (CEE 6312, 6350, 6319), two undergraduate courses (CEE 4300, 3340), and one graduate seminar course (8095C). She has developed entirely new materials for CEE 4300, 6312, and 6350. She has also developed new laboratory modules for CEE 3340 and 6319. * CEE 3340 Environmental Engineering Undergraduate Lab * CEE 4300 Environmental Engineering Systems * CEE 6312 Chemical Principles in Environmental Engineering * CEE 6350 Advanced Environmental Chemistry * CEE 6319 Environmental Science and Engineering Graduate Lab * CEE 8095C Environmental Research Seminar: Water C. Other Teaching Activities and Highlights Outreach Activities In the 2010 Fall semester, Dr. Huang led the students in her course (CEE 3340 Environmental Engineering Undergraduate Lab) to conduct a water quality survey project for the Piedmont Park

Atlanta. In this project, Dr. Huang combined classroom lectures and lab activities and designed a project to meet PPC's need to evaluate their water quality in the newly expanded areas. Students were able to apply learned theories and techniques and provide valuable technical service to the local community. Web-Based Teaching Tools Prof. Huang has created individual websites for each of her courses to serve multiple functions including depository of lecture handouts, supplementary reading materials, exam/homework solutions, student projects, etc. The websites have been used as a vital interactive learning tool, particularly for sharing and exchange of information among students at different Georgia Tech campuses and other distance-learning locations. Distance-Learning/Continuing Education Prof. Huang has also offered her courses of Chemical Principles in Environmental Engineering (CEE 6312), Advanced Environmental Chemistry (CEE 6350), and Environmental Engineering Systems (CEE 4300) as video-based courses for continuing education students or for students located at a different campus. The distance-learning courses were offered simultaneously with on-campus sessions with the assistance from Georgia Tech's Center of Distance Learning (DL) Program. Prof. Huang has taught more than 60 DL students over the years and is experienced in this teaching format. 18 6/7/2011
